result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Status conference on November 17, 2022 at 09:30 am.

12:02 PM Cases 22CF21, 22CF146, 22CM37, and 22CF49 called together.  Defendant Lisa Lynn Haler appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Michelle M Erdman in court for Lisa Lynn Haler.  Prosecuting attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Case on for Status Conference.  Defense attorney updates the Court: waiting for the lab weight.  Court to set additional status conference.  Atty Erdman will file a bond motion shortly.  Bond continues.
Status conference scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 09:30 am.

11:56 AM Cases 22CF146, 22CM37, 22CF49, and 22CF21 called together.  Prosecuting attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Lisa Lynn Haler appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Michelle M Erdman in court for Lisa Lynn Haler. Case on for Status Conference.  Defense attorney updates the Court: defense wants State to send in evidence for lab weight in 22CF146.  State responds- was sent to lab on 7/14.  Current offer recited.
Status conference scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Status conference on September 15, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Status conference on August 18, 2022 at 11:45 am.

9:16 AM Cases 22CF21, 22CF49, 22CF146, and 22CM37 called together.  Prosecuting attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Lisa Lynn Haler appeared by video, in custody.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin appeared by video.  Attorney Michelle M Erdman in court for Lisa Lynn Haler.  Def appears from Bayfield County Jail.  Atty Erdman updates the Court- has been appointed now on all matters.  Court reviews status of the cases.  Case 22CF146 is now on for initial appearance. Defendant acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading.  Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights.  Waiver of Preliminary Hearing:  Court informs def of rights to PH; waived by def.  Court finds waiver of right to PH knowingly, freely, voluntarily made.  Court finds factual basis for bind over.  State files information mirroring complaint.  Case on for Arraignment.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of information, def. waives reading.  Court informs def. of charges, possible penalties and rights.  NG plea entered to all counts.  Atty Erdman notes the newest case is not currently part of the agreement, will discuss.  Bonds continue.  Atty has until next hearing to file the motion.
Status conference scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 11:45 am.
OSPD Appointment of Counsel Report - Eligible

9:54 AM Cases 22CF21, 22CF49, 22GF159, and 22CM37 called together.  Prosecuting attorney James Jay Rennicke Esq in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Lisa Lynn Haler appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Michelle M Erdman in court for Lisa Lynn Haler.  Court notes new PC came in last night (22GF159); Court reads the new PC to the parties.  State asks for $50k cash bond.  Atty Erdman argues for less.  Court sets $50k cash bond, forfeits previously posted cash.  Court finds PC for arrest.
Status conference scheduled for July 13, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
